title: HDMI no signal. Please help!
body: Sometimes while I'm playing a game my monitor will randomly shut off and on the blue screen it says "HDMI No Signal". How do I fix this? Thanks.

replies.body:
Hey mate

I work in events and manage audio visual equipment as part of this role.

HDMI is notoriously fickle and cables are also prone to a lot of faults. From what you are saying i wager one of the following issues is present;

The HDMI cable is bust. Try replacing it with a nice, short and non cheap replacement. (Most likely) 

The HDMI input/output on either your monitor or PC is faulty

Output resolution on your PC is too high for the monitor 

Try a diff cable and report back!

While it's possible it's due to the cable/output, he says it only occurs while playing games.

My best guess would be your GPU is overheating or the drivers are crashing, check your temperatures next time you're playing. There's many free tools out there to accomplish this, i'd recommend [speedfan](http://www.almico.com/speedfan.php)

The computer would still stay on if your graphics drivers are crashing.

Does video return after a short period? or do you have to restart your computer to resolve the issue.
If video does return, does windows notify you of your drivers crashing at all?

Check your event log to determine the cause of the issue if it's on the computer's side, otherwise Saturok's suggestions might help.

Ok, I think I MAY have fixed it.
The problem was Event ID 41 according to my Event Properties which said "The system has rebooted without cleanly shutting down first. This error could be caused if the system stopped responding, crashed, or lost power unexpectedly." This issue was apparently to do with my HDD automatically turning off after 20 minutes.
